poem:
### Disconnected

Beyond the hum of wireless skies,  
an 80-year-old man sits in silence,  
each dial tone a memory lost—the weight of sound.  
His voice, an ocean away, holds tales  
for Canada and Japan, now cocooned  
in static solitude.  
Where words once bridged the longing,  
now absence haunts the line.
